SENT.plain: Three patients with benign intracranial hypertension ([BIH], or pseudotumor cerebri) had verified increased CSF pressure and unilateral papilledema
One patient had slowly progressive loss of visual acuity until unilateral optic nerve sheathotomy was performed
One patient had spontaneous venous pulsation in the unaffected eye
The diagnosis of BIH must be considered even in the absence of bilateral papilledema
